April 26, 1954
Dr, Kenneth 8, Oberholtzer
Superintendent of Schools
Denver Public Schools
Administration Building
414 Fourteenth Street
Denver 2, Colorado
Deer Dr. Cberholtaer:
I hasten to answer your letter of April 22, just received. As
you will see from the various items attached, the FAB has recently
granted the KAES funds with which to consolidate Personnel-Placement
efforts for educational television and radio. The letter from Mr. Griffiths
to Hr* Mullen (dittoed copy attached) explains this clearly, I believe.
In a few days you will be receiving front our Mr. Don Walker, who is in
charge of this service for us, and whoa you may contact directly, ques¬
tionnaires to enable us to help you.
Meanwhile, the entire Mew Jersey staff is available as will
be noted from the attached. This is the best source of personnel (of the
sort I think you noed) that I know of at the moment, though I am asking
Mr. Walker to scrutinise all files as they come in, and try to help you
find the beet poseihle candidates.
Incidentally may we circularise this position to prospective
candidates? Within the next few weeks Mr. Walker hopes to have job
analyses and descriptions available which will give us s batter answer
than we now have to the statement of desirable qualifications for managers
and other positions. I shall see that you have the best thinking avail¬
able on this as soon as it ic avail able. A recent article in the ABET
Journal, by Dr. Walter Emery, will be enclosed with this letter if we
still have s copy available. Otherwise a copy can be secured direct
from Dr. Emery at the JC8T address in Washington.
